○ Field density to be not less than 98%. If the density is less than 98% then a Hold Point to be raised for the nonconforming Lot.

3.4 - Binder – Binder Consistency Testing or Confirmation
Frequency - Every Delivery to Production Plant
Acceptance Criteria - For every batch of polymer modified binder production either:
a. Provide written confirmation that the raw ingredients are consistent with the modified binder used to produce the asphalt mixture.
b. Sample and test the binder according to Clause Cl 204.
Inspection/Test Method - Written Confirmation/ Test Method and Results
Record of conformity - NATA Test Report
Acceptance Criteria - Every production batch of binder must be sampled at the point of production and tested by the Contractor, for:
a. Viscosity at 165°C according to ATM-111.
b. Torsional recovery at 25°C, 30 s according to ATM-122.
c. Softening point according to AG: PT/T131.
Inspection/Test Method - Test Method and Results
Record of conformity - NATA Test Report
Frequency - Every Ten modified production batches

Acceptance Criteria - Additional production testing must be performed at least once every ten modified binder production batches, or once every 250 tonnes of modified binder production, whichever is more often.
Inspection/Test Method - Test Method and Results
Record of conformity - NATA Test Report
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of asphalt production

Acceptance Criteria - Binder must be sampled for each delivery vessel/tank, not more than four hours prior to the commencement of asphalt production or transfer of binder to the asphalt product plant binder storage tank.
○ A minimum of two samples, each not less than 0.5 L in volume, must be obtained in accordance with ATM-101.
Inspection/Test Method - Test Method and Results
Record of conformity - Sampling Process Control Charts

Acceptance Criteria - The point of delivery sample, to be retained for point of delivery testing, must be tested by the Contractor, prior to the commencement of asphalt production for the work period, for:
a. Viscosity at 165°C according to ATM-111.
b. Torsional recovery at 25°C, 30 s according to ATM-122.
c. Softening point according to AG:PT/T131.

Acceptance Criteria - Tack coat shall not be applied on a wet surface, or when the surface temperature is below 5°C, or when the weather conditions would prevent the proper application or adhesion of the tack coat.

Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Site Supervisor
Acceptance Criteria - Tack coat must be applied to the prepared surface at a rate of 0.2-0.3 L/m2 of residual bituminous material, calculated at 25°C.
○ Vertical faces of milled and excavated existing pavement must be thoroughly tack coated by hand lance or other method.
○ Tack coated surfaces must be protected from construction equipment trafficking to the extent reasonably achievable.
○ Asphalt paving must not commence until emulsified tack coat is substantially broken over more than 80% of the surface of the paving run.

○ Average Air Voids: Minimum 3% and Maximum 7.5%
